body.p: offers supporttwo methods for importing HTML files into an XML document. The first method is to simply copy data from an HTML document and paste it into a document in Author mode, but this is only supported in DITA, DocBook, TEI, JATS, and XHTML documents. also offers a configurable import wizard that works with any type of XML document.

section.title: Smart Paste Method
section.p: If you are importing data into DITA, DocBook, TEI, JATS, or XHTML documents, you can open the HTML document in your web browser, copy its content, and paste it into your document in Author mode.

section.title: Import Wizard Method
section.p:
To use the Import wizard to import from HTML files, follow these steps:
Go to File Import HTML File
File Import
HTML File . The Import HTML wizard is displayed.
Select a parent folder and file name for the resulting XHTML document.
Enter the URL of the HTML document.
Select the type of the resulting XHTML document:
XHTML5
XHTML 1.0 Transitional
XHTML 1.0 Strict
Click the OKFinish button.

Result: The resulting document is an XHTML file containing a DOCTYPE declaration that references the XHTML DTD definition on the Web. The parsed content of the imported file is transformed to XHTML5, XHTML Transitional, or XHTML Strict depending on the option you chose.
